name: places/ChIJK-F0RLBZwokRxULa33P3y1g
formattedAddress: 320 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
adrFormatAddress: 320 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text:
Please read! I decided not to sign a lease as Elena has been hard to impossible to work with. She is beyond not helpful and her responses are short, unprofessional and often rude. She comes across extremely condescending, arrogant and has a very patronizing demeanor. She carries herself as she does not care if somebody takes the apartment and she is better than any potential tenants! When we want to lease a two bedroom apartment, we don’t know why we would have to subject ourselves to this behavior. We have lived in other glenwood managed buildings and loved them but never met a more arrogant and unhelpful person like her. While touring an apartment with her she could not have put less effort and look more bored. She barely told us anything and anything we asked her we received an unhelpful response. We have friends living in this building and they hated to deal with her too! Other friends did not move in too because of her. While the building is nice and they are at good occupancy rate, she needs substantial training. Please get her training. She is unpleasant to work with and I have heard this from multiple people too. We took our business to a high end building who were happy to lease us a two bed room and we could not be happier! Feeling welcome when u pay such a steep rent is always good! Glenwood should implement a survey to gauge feedback on her after each signed lease or touring apartment! Please be warned - u will leave stressed and frustrated after an appointment with her! She also needs training on how to write emails. She fails to respond to requests or questions asked and just sends short and not very helpful emails with leaving open questions. We asked if we can talk to her to be more efficient after some emails that left us more confused due to her mistakes and lack of details but she never responded to that request. I feel you get boilerplate emails from her and she does not read your email carefully! She definitely needs substantial coaching and training on how to work with clients.

Also Frank is extremely rude and not helpful.

originalText.text: Recently viewed the building and the area. Absolutely beautiful, very nice people. Hoping to live here soon!

text.text: Recently viewed the building and the area. Absolutely beautiful, very nice people. Hoping to live here soon!

originalText.text:
I lived here for two years and I miss it dearly.

The apartment (2b2b, facing the inner courtyard) was great, the building had no major issues (boy, do I miss having elevators that just show up almost instantly), great amenities (miss the swimming pool and jacuzzi so very much), and super friendly staff (shout-out to Sebastian, whose efficiency is just out-of-this-world).

They also did a great job of managing things throughout the pandemic, which I greatly appreciated.

We only moved because we needed a change of pace (away from the crowded/touristy neighborhood and everything that was happening in midtown, and into a calmer area more suitable for small kids); otherwise, we would have kept on renewing our lease.

originalText.text:
Overall the building is nice; however, there are a few things that are just not working:
1) Mail room: had a few instances where they could not find a package, gave me a wrong package or recorded a package as mine while it was somebody else’s as they labeled it with the wrong apartment number
2) Outside noise: it is really loud during the night as the sanitation comes every night to pick up the trash and also work is being done on the streets. Wake up almost every night!
3) Pool: closed on certain days when it should be open but no notification
4) Appliances: old and even if they break you get older ones which last for a bit but are just not that great
5) Amenities: Gym and pool area and sometimes lounge area are dirty and sometimes appear run down. Some Gym machines are sticky and floor is very dirty. Sauna is barely cleaned and pool has so much chlorine that sometimes u get a rash. Pool and pool area are a bit dirty.
6) apartments are extremely cold - no insulation! Full glass front window is very thin and apartments are freezing! Be aware that you will have to pay a ton for heating!!

Emerald Green responded below that heating is paid for but that is not true. I live in a newly renovated apartment and turning on the heat or AC causes my electricity bill to GO UP TONS! Not sure where this is coming from that it is included in our rent!!!

originalText.text: Moved in for two years, meet some of the most responsible and kindest building staffs. Reggie the doorman is such a funny guy, always gives warm greetings. Never lost a package or anything like how I used to stay in other luxury buildings
